medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Chest pain started 1 hour earlier and had awakened him from sleep. The pain was severe, sub-sternal, burning, radiating to the left arm, and accompanied by nausea and non-bilious, nonbloody vomiting. For the past month, he experienced intermittent chest pain of a similar character but less intense, which lasted for hours to days at a time. The pain was not related to exertion. Antacids and omeprazole had provided temporary relief.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of premature coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: He does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs. He is employed as a physician.
